summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to attorney Jack Scarola transmitting the confidential Non-Prosecution Agreement for Jeffrey Epstein, with instructions to restrict disclosure only to those who have signed a Protective Order.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing the Non-Prosecution Agreement; instructed to restrict disclosure of the document.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual who is the subject of the Non-Prosecution Agreement attached to the email.

connections.description: Scarola is an attorney receiving the confidential Non-Prosecution Agreement related to Epstein, indicating a legal representation or advisory role.

events.title: Transmission of Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails the confidential Non-Prosecution Agreement regarding Jeffrey Epstein to attorney Jack Scarola.

keyFacts: A Non-Prosecution Agreement for Jeffrey Epstein was finalized and transmitted by federal prosecutors in December 2008.
The agreement was treated as highly confidential, with disclosure restricted only to individuals who had signed a Protective Order.
The email indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Epstein's legal team regarding the handling of the sensitive agreement.
